image.altText: A man begging with his dog.

props.synopsis: Since the Great Depression, begging for money has been illegal in Tasmania but now there is a push to, as one expert says, "tackle social issues in a rational, mature and modern way".

title.children: Almost 90 years ago during the Great Depression, begging was made illegal in Tasmania. It still is

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair sits on a pink couch and looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: When Jo O'Brien lost $500,000 to a scammer, she set out to track him down, eventually finding the man she believed was responsible. She sent him a text.

title.children: Jo was scammed out of $500,000. She threatened to 'ruin' lives to get her life savings back

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wears a suit and white shirt looking sternly

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court's chief prosecutor says he believes Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defence Minister Yoav Gallant and three Hamas leaders are responsible for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip and Israel.

title.children: Arrest warrants sought for Benjamin Netanyahu, Hamas leaders over alleged war crimes

image.altText: Unidentified uni students seen from behind.

props.synopsis: With a cap on international students each university can have announced by the Federal government, Tasmania's university is asking staff how it can save money.

title.children: Limit on international student numbers forces Tasmania's uni to embark on cost-cutting drive

image.altText: Screenshot of Pulse Tasmania Facebook post.

props.synopsis: A local media organisation has been reported to Equal Opportunity Tasmania, following concerns from the multicultural community that it did not do enough to moderate comments on a recent post.

title.children: Pulse Tasmania's Facebook page reported to anti-discrimination body over alleged racist comments on post

image.altText: Nina taking a selfie with her son Jerome.

props.synopsis: Children are gathering large followings and earning thousands of dollars through social media influencing — but some warn it comes with a dark side.

title.children: Jerome is a 4yo model who makes thousands of dollars. But his social media fame has a dark side

image.altText: people walking past large sandstone arches in uq st lucia's great court

props.synopsis: Wiley's Hindawi scandal offers a window into a thriving black market of fake science, corrupted research and bogus authorship. It also illuminates a much broader crisis of trust confronting universities and scientific institutions worldwide.

title.children: The Wiley scandal illuminates a much bigger crisis of trust confronting universities around the world

image.altText: A video frame showing a woman sitting among audience members, with onscreen text.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers stands firm on Q+A in the face of direct appeals to do more to make the property market fairer and lift people out of poverty.

title.children: 'We can't survive': Pleas to the treasurer for help on housing and cost of living

image.altText: Two researchers in green hazmat suits inspecting a line of dead skua carcasses.

props.synopsis: A deadly strain of avian influenza has breached the world's most remote continent. Scientists say it's only a matter of time before it reaches Australia.

title.children: On the planet's most remote continent, a deadly virus is leaving a 'trail of destruction' that has scientists on edge

image.altText: Julian Assange looks to the camera as he is photographed from behind glass with graffiti etched into it. His grey hair is back.

props.synopsis: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is granted leave to appeal against his extradition to the United States, after his lawyers tell a London court he would "discriminated against" in the US judicial system because he was Australian.

title.children: Assange granted last-gasp appeal in bid to avoid US extradition

image.altText: A close up of Ebrahim Raisi wearing a black turban and looking over his shoulder while wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Ebrahim Raisi meticulously planned his rise to power in a brutal regime. But a freak accident brought him down at a critical moment in the Middle East.

title.children: 'He has so many enemies': Why the fiery death of the 'Butcher of Tehran' could spark chaos in Iran

image.altText: Colourful shipping containers stacked on top of the other, with high-rise buildings in the distance.

props.synopsis: We've joined our global peers by embracing the new economic mood in pursuit of a Future Made in Australia. But it remains to be seen whether we've learnt anything from the successes and failures of globalisation over the past 30 years.

title.children: The world is retreating from globalisation. What does it mean for us?

image.altText: Houses on a cliff edge in the northern Illawarra region.

props.synopsis: Extreme weather linked to climate change risks negatively affecting coastal property market values, as storm-related damage and erosion takes its toll and insurance premiums soar.

title.children: Coastal property owners warned of rising climate-related risks

image.altText: A fire breaks out next to Dumbea Mall in Koutio, Dumbea, New Caledoni

props.synopsis: Separatists in riot-hit New Caledonia refuse to abandon roadblocks that have paralysed much of the Pacific archipelago and halted commercial air traffic, defying a major security operation by French forces.

title.children: Demonstrators in riot-hit New Caledonia refuse to abandon road blocks

image.altText: A small plane is loaded up on an outer island in Vanuatu.

props.synopsis: Air Vanuatu's collapse has raised questions about the future of aviation in the Pacific. While experts say the problems are vast, there are glimmers of hope for the region's airlines.

title.children: Pacific airlines face high costs and a vast ocean. How can they keep going?

image.altText: A man walks past a newsagent advertising lotto

props.synopsis: Once restricted to newsagents in New South Wales, lottery tickets are now sold in bottle shops, chemists and service stations, making them easier to buy for those struggling to control their gambling habits.

title.children: You can now buy a scratchie with your six pack as retail outlets embrace lottery products

image.altText: Composite image of Ben Stokes catching and then dropping the ball during an Ashes Test at The Oval.

props.synopsis: The tumultuous and at-times tempestuous 2023 Ashes is the subject of the third season of docuseries The Test, with cameras given access to the Australian locker room during the drama-filled contest.

title.children: 'There was blokes yelling everywhere': The chaos behind the Ashes' forgotten Spirit of Cricket debate revealed in new series

image.altText: IF hero shot

props.synopsis: It's a kids' film about troubled imaginary friends but, led by writer/director/star John Krasinski, IF features some of the biggest names in Hollywood right now.

title.children: IF is one of 2024's few big budget films that isn't a remake or part of a franchise. But does it work?

image.altText: Satellite floating in space.

props.synopsis: Satellites are under threat like never before and more countries are preparing for wars in space. So, what exactly is going on above the atmosphere? And should we be worried?

title.children: More weapons and 'unfriendly behaviours': How the world is preparing for war in space

image.altText: A grinning, bearded man wearing a cap holds up a large silver trophy.

props.synopsis: The Liverpool FC manager spent the past decade revitalising one of England's biggest clubs. His departure is a reminder of the legacy he leaves behind.

title.children: 'A memory for a lifetime': Jürgen Klopp leaves a football legacy far greater than silverware

image.altText: A group of people standing on a rugby field.

props.synopsis: The federal government and the NRL are closing in on a deal worth up to $600 million to secure a new NRL side based in Papua New Guinea.

title.children: Federal government close to securing $600m deal for new Papua New Guinea NRL side

image.altText: Images from Virgin free cruise promotion Instagram reel.

props.synopsis: Virgin staff dancing at the boarding gate, a call from Richard Branson announcing they'd all won a free cruise, passengers wearing hats and filmed celebrating — but this winner says due to a change in itinerary, to claim her prize will cost her thousands.

title.children: Virgin passengers were told they'd won a free cruise, but some can't redeem the prize

image.altText: Dozens of hikers walk up a steep hill high above the cloud level wearing headlamps

props.synopsis: The new measures come into force after hundreds of thousands of people climbed the peak last year.

title.children: Tourists now need to book to climb one of the world's most iconic volcanoes

image.altText: A man in a suit with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Six days after delivering his make-or-break budget, treasurer Jim Chalmers faced his own constituents in a special Q+A from Logan, south of Brisbane.

title.children: Jim Chalmers faces voters on Q+A a week after delivering budget — as it happened

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

props.synopsis: A long-running inquest into the deaths of four Aboriginal women killed by their partners in the Northern Territory has heard police response times have worsened over the past 12 months.

title.children: NT domestic violence inquest hears of increasing priority-one emergency calls, lack of police

image.altText: A woman with blond hair sits outside, gazing into the distance

props.synopsis: The government is sticking by its National Plan to End Violence Against Women and Children, but a co-author of the scheme says Labor is failing to back it up with adequate investment.

title.children: 'Ambition without investment': Federal government accused of failing to invest in plan to end gendered violence

image.altText: Sir Samuel Way court building on Victoria Square

props.synopsis: Rapist Mohammad Ali Ahmad Rezaei, who "terrorised" an Adelaide woman for three years, has been jailed for more than two decades, while the victim has been praised for her "bravery and courage" in reporting his crimes to police.

title.children: Rapist jailed for two decades for 'terrorising' woman over three years

image.altText: Police in white cover-all suits stand in a passageway between units

props.synopsis: Police believe the 38-year-old had an access visit on the day and the boy's mother raised concerns when he was not returned as expected.

title.children: 'A more tragic event you wouldn't come across': Bodies of man and 2yo son found in Lismore unit

image.altText: Ali Cobby Eckermann, a 60-year-old Aboriginal woman with red hair. She is smiling at the camera, and standing in a hallway.

props.synopsis: After winning $215,000, Ali Cobby Eckermann took time off from writing. Now her new book She Is the Earth has won the top prize at the NSW Premier's Literary Awards.

title.children: Aboriginal poet wins $40,000 at major literary awards with 'profound' verse novel

image.altText: A man holding a hiking stick.

props.synopsis: Three Catholic high schools on the NSW Central Coast have cancelled planned visits from conservative American "chastity speaker" Jason Evert following pressure from students and parents. The schools say students can instead attend an opt-in live stream.

title.children: Schools cancel US 'chastity speaker' live events after backlash from parents, students

image.altText: A bicycle rider rides away from the camera across a suspension bridge over a river.

props.synopsis: The same week a mountain-biking trail bridge across the Mersey River was installed, it washed away. A second, more sturdier version also washed away in another flood. Now it is hoped a third bridge will be the last.

title.children: Third time's the charm for council bridge repeatedly washed away in floods

image.altText: An NRL team coach looks on and grimaces before a match.

props.synopsis: After a woeful run of results, Parramatta has fired 49-year-old Brad Arthur, who has been the Eels' coach since 2014.

title.children: Parramatta Eels sack coach Brad Arthur

image.altText: an image of a crime scene at a KFC

props.synopsis: A court has heard a Casino teenager killed in a fatal 2022 stabbing challenged his alleged attacker, who claims self-defence, to a "one on one" multiple times.

title.children: Supreme court hears intense rivalry between teenagers resulted in fatal stabbing in KFC car park

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of a smiling Brett Maston against a beige background.

props.synopsis: Police in WA arrest a convicted armed robber who had allegedly removed his electronic monitoring device.

title.children: Armed robber once dubbed Australia's most wanted apprehended after allegedly removing ankle bracelet

image.altText: Graphic image man who is bald and has a beard surrounded by images of food

props.synopsis: Shaun Christie-David is a radical restaurateur who's employing the "unemployable" and giving away thousands of free meals.

title.children: Shaun was always ashamed of what was in his lunchbox. Now it's at the heart of his radical restaurant empire
